snippet: The Grünenthal Group’s apology, but no admission of liability, came 50 years after the defect-causing drug was taken off the market.
abstract: Grunenthal Group, the German manufacturer of the morning sickness drug thalidomide, which has been linked to birth defects, issues an apology to victims of the drug and their families; storm of protests the apology provokes from victims and groups that represent them suggests that it has done little to assuage the anger and hurt accumulated over decades of campaigning for full acknowledgment of the drug's harmful effects, and for more generous compensation.
lead_paragraph: The Grünenthal Group’s apology, but no admission of liability, came 50 years after the defect-causing drug was taken off the market.
